item.description:
Another cult classic.

Cinestudio presents the 35th Anniversary uncut restoration, on film, of the cult science fiction movie that is more hauntingly alien than two movies that opened a year later: Star Wars and Close Encounters of the Third Kind. David Bowie in his androgynous 70s persona was perfectly cast as a stranger in a strange land, who lands on Planet Earth with inventions he hopes will raise enough money to save his dying planet. But distracted by booze, tv, sexy Candy Clark and the histrionics of Rip Torn, Bowie finds his dreams slipping away... A gorgeous visual trip by Nicholas Roeg (Walkabout, Don’t Look Back) that only comes truly alive on the big screen.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: The Man Who Fell To Earth
